newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: Venezuela sets 100 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.
newsitem.headline: Venezuela sets 100 bln bolivar TEM auction Wed.

text.p: The Central Bank of Venezuela announced for Wednesday morning a 60 billion bolivar ($126 million) auction of 178-day VE6MTMA=RR "monetary stabilization," or TEM, bills with a 18.16 percent coupon.

The bank said it would also offer 20 billion bolivars ($42 million) in 267-day bills VE9MTMA=RR with a 18.56 percent coupon, and another 20 billion bolivars of 358-day bills VE1YTMA=RR with a 18.98 percent coupon.
Some 27 billion bolivars of TEMs are due to mature on Thursday.

Coupons at the Wednesday auction are down from last week's 100 billion bolivar issue. Then 178-, 267- and 358-day notes carried 18.93, 19.36, and 19.81 percent coupons respectively for effective yields that softened gently to 18.16, 19.45 and 20.42 percent.
The weekly TEM bill auctions are the Central Bank's principal tool of monetary policy, used to restrict liquidity and establish a benchmark for wider interest rates.
